# Indices
## The Laws of Indices

|Category |Law |Examples |Comments|
|:---|:---|:---|:---|
|Multiplication |$a^xa^y = a^{a+y}$ |*Example 1:*<br>$$\begin{aligned}
2^3\times2^5\\
=(2\times2\times2)\times(2\times2\times2\times2\times2)\\
=2^8
\end{aligned}$$<br>*Example 2:*<br>$$\begin{aligned}
3^4\times3^2\times3\\
=3^4\times3^2\times3^1\\
=3^{4+2+1}\\
=3^7
\end{aligned}$$<br>*Example 3:*<br>$$\begin{aligned}
6^3\times15^2\times10^5\\
=(2^3\times3^3)\times(3^2\times5^2)\times(5^5\times2^5)\\
=2^8\times3^5\times5^7
\end{aligned}$$ |When you multiply by powers of 2 you **add** the indices.|
|Division |$\frac{a^x}{a^y}=a^{x-y}$ |*Example 1:*<br>$$\begin{aligned}
\frac{2^8}{2^5}\\
=\frac{2\times2\times2\times2\times2\times2\times2\times2}{2\times2\times2\times2\times2}\\
=\frac{2}{2}\times\frac{2}{2}\times\frac{2}{2}\times\frac{2}{2}\times\frac{2}{2}\times\frac{2}{1}\times\frac{2}{1}\times\frac{2}{1}\\
=1\times1\times1\times1\times1\times2\times2\times2\\
=2^3
\end{aligned}$$<br>*Example 2:*<br>$$\begin{aligned}
\frac{15^3\times3^2}{5^2}\\
=\frac{3^3\times5^3\times3^2}{5^2}\\
=3^{3+2}\times5^{3-2}\\
=3^5\times5
\end{aligned}$$ |When you divide by the powers of 2, you **subtract** the indices.|
|Powers |$(a^x)^y=a^{xy}$ |*Example 1:*<br>$$\begin{aligned}
(3^5)^4\\
=3^5\times3^5\times3^5\times3^5\\
=3^{20}
\end{aligned}$$ |When you raise a power by another power you **multiply** the indices.|
|Other rules |$a^0=1$ (for $a>0$)<br>$a^{-x}=\frac{1}{a^x}$<br>$a^{\frac{y}{x}}=\sqrt[x]{a^y}$|||
